00018 #include <systemc>
00019 
00020 #ifndef TLM_DMI_HEADER
00021 #define TLM_DMI_HEADER
00022 
00023 class tlm_dmi
00024 {
00025 public:
00026 
00027   tlm_dmi()
00028   {
00029     init();
00030   }
00031   
00032   void init()
00033   {
00034     dmi_ptr = 0;
00035     dmi_start_address = 0x0;
00036     dmi_end_address = (sc_dt::uint64)-1;
00037     type = READ_WRITE;
00038     read_latency = sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME;
00039     write_latency = sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME;
00040     endianness = TLM_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
00041   }
00042   
00043   // If the forward call is successful, the target returns the dmi_ptr,
00044   // which must point to the data element corresponding to the
00045   // dmi_start_address. The data is organized as a byte array with the
00046   // endianness of the target (endianness member of the tlm_dmi struct).
00047   unsigned char* dmi_ptr;
00048   
00049   // The absolut start and end addresses of the DMI region. If the decoder
00050   // logic in the interconnect changes the address field e.g. by masking, the
00051   // interconnect is responsible to transform the relative address back to a
00052   // absolute address again.
00053   sc_dt::uint64 dmi_start_address;
00054   sc_dt::uint64 dmi_end_address;
00055 
00056   // The type accesses this DMI range support. If eg the 'forReads' parameter
00057   // of the 'get_direct_mem_ptr' call is set to true, a target must set this
00058   // attribute to READ (in case the range is only for read accesses) or READ_WRITE
00059   // (in case the range supports both read and write accesses). if the 'forReads'
00060   // parameter is false a target must set this to WRITE or READ_WRITE.
00061   enum Type { READ = 0x1, WRITE = 0x2, READ_WRITE = READ|WRITE };
00062   Type type;
00063     
00064   // These members define the latency of read/write transactions. The
00065   // initiator must initialize these members to zero before requesting a
00066   // dmi pointer, because both the interconnect as well as the target can
00067   // add to the total transaction latency.
00068   // Depending on the 'type' attribute only one, or both of these attributes
00069   // will be valid.
00070   sc_core::sc_time  read_latency;
00071   sc_core::sc_time  write_latency;
00072   
00073   // The target sets the endianness of the data in the dmi_ptr array.
00074   tlm_endianness endianness;
00075 };
00076 
00077 #endif /* TLM_DMI_HEADER */
